intro: Schwartzia brenesii, commonly known as the Costa Rican sandalwood, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, dark-colored wood. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and often have a waxy texture. It produces small, yellowish flowers followed by spherical fruits containing smooth, black seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Schwartzia brenesii is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
